Posted By: Jake1991 (7/9/2010 8:53:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of the scariest cards I've ever seen. I've turned my 1/1 myrs into 12/12 beasts with these guys in mid-length games.
  
   
Also, like Myr Galvanizers, they're great removal magnets that basically force your oppoent to get rid of them if they can, freeing you up to play some big guys (like Battlespheres) with much less worry.
  
   
This plus contagion engine is just nonsensical nonsense. Frist, all your creatures get smaller, all my creatures get bigger. Then next turn, all your creatures DIE, and all my now hugantic creatures kill you in one glorious charge. Wonderful.
posts.html:
One of the scariest cards I've ever seen. I've turned my 1/1 myrs into 12/12 beasts with these guys in mid-length games.

Also, like Myr Galvanizers, they're great removal magnets that basically force your oppoent to get rid of them if they can, freeing you up to play some big guys (like Battlespheres) with much less worry.

This plus contagion engine is just nonsensical nonsense. Frist, all your creatures get smaller, all my creatures get bigger. Then next turn, all your creatures DIE, and all my now hugantic creatures kill you in one glorious charge. Wonderful.

posts.post_content: I love artifact decks and play them almost exclusively, but this and [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key) being in the same set just before Scars of Mirrodin, which presumably will be artifact-heavy, makes me a little nervous about the metagame.
